alert.note: Alert for Chilton; Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chilton and southwestern Coosa Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 935 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dollar, or 10 miles west of Rockford, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clanton, Jemison, Thorsby, Plecher, Lyle, Mitchell Lake, Dollar, Gap Of The Mountain, Lay Lake Dam, Unity, Moriah, Higgins Ferry Park, Verbena, Pooles Crossroads, Bentleyville, Lay Lake, Lomax, Waxahatchee Creek, Paint Creek and I 65 Rest Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and east central Alabama.
